'''Beregond, Anders Stenström''' (born [[1957]]) is a Swedish [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] scholar.

Since [[1967]], Stenström has been an enthusiast of Tolkien, and since [[1976]], when he became a member of the Tolkien Society [[Forodrim]], he carries the byname Beregond. 

Beregond has researched different aspects of the works of Tolkien (among his contributions can be found suggestions on principles for [[structural references]]), published several articles, and been a speaker at and organizer of conferences and conventions. Together with Kristina Valinger, Beregond was responsible for the creation of the Swedish subtitles for [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|Peter Jackson's ''The Lord of the Rings'']]. He was consulted for [[Erik Andersson]]'s new Swedish translation of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. He is the translator of [[The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien]] and [[Bilbo's Last Song]] into Swedish. 

He is currently one of the organizers of [[Omentielva]], the International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien's Invented Languages, a series of biennial conferences at changing locations. He is also editor of [[Arda (annual)|''Arda'']] and ''Arda Philology''.

Stenström lives in [[wikipedia:Alby, Botkyrka|Alby, Botkyrka]] within the [[wikipedia:Stockholm urban area|Stockholm urban area]] and works as a [[wikipedia:Verger#Modern function|verger]].
